epics.title: User Authentication and Authorization
epics.summary: Implement user authentication and authorization features.
epics.description: Develop the user authentication and authorization system using Next.js on the frontend and Node.js on the backend. Include features like user registration, login, logout, and role-based access control. Use PostgreSQL to store user credentials securely.

epics.title: Database Schema Design
epics.summary: Design the database schema to support the e-commerce functionality.
epics.description: Create the database schema using PostgreSQL to support various aspects of the e-commerce website. This includes tables for users, products, categories, orders, and other necessary entities. Ensure proper relationships and indexing for efficient data retrieval.

epics.title: Basic UI Layout
epics.summary: Create the basic user interface layout for the e-commerce website.
epics.description: Develop the basic UI layout using Next.js. This includes the main navigation, header, footer, and overall design framework for the e-commerce platform.

epics.title: Product Catalog
epics.description: Develop the product catalog feature using Next.js for the frontend and Node.js for the backend. This includes displaying products with their details, filtering, and sorting options. Ensure that the product information is retrieved from the PostgreSQL database.

epics.title: Shopping Cart
epics.description: Implement the shopping cart feature using Next.js on the frontend and Node.js on the backend. Users should be able to add products to the cart, update quantities, and remove items. The cart state should be stored in PostgreSQL for persistence.

epics.title: Checkout and Payment Gateway Integration
epics.summary: Integrate a payment gateway and develop the checkout flow.
epics.description: Develop the checkout flow using Next.js and Node.js, and integrate a payment gateway (such as Stripe). This includes order review, payment processing, and order confirmation. Ensure that the order information is stored in PostgreSQL.

epics.title: Order Management
epics.summary: Implement order management features for users and administrators.
epics.description: Develop the order management system using Next.js for the frontend and Node.js for the backend. Users should be able to view their order history, and administrators should be able to manage and update order statuses. All order data should be stored in PostgreSQL.

epics.title: User Profile and Account Management
epics.summary: Implement features for user profile and account management.
epics.description: Develop user profile and account management features using Next.js and Node.js. Users should be able to update their personal information, change passwords, and manage their accounts. Ensure that user information is securely stored and retrieved from PostgreSQL.

epics.title: Product Reviews and Ratings
epics.summary: Add the ability for users to leave reviews and ratings for products.
epics.description: Implement a product review and rating system using Next.js for the frontend and Node.js for the backend. Users should be able to leave reviews and ratings for purchased products. Store review data in PostgreSQL and display it on the product detail pages.

epics.title: Analytics and Reporting
epics.summary: Integrate analytics and generate reports for the e-commerce platform.
epics.description: Develop analytics and reporting features using Next.js and Node.js. This includes tracking sales, user behavior, and other key metrics. Generate reports to provide insights into the performance of the e-commerce website.

user_stories.epic_title: Implement user authentication and authorization features.
user_stories.title: Develop user registration capability
user_stories.description:
As a new user, I want to register on the platform, so that I can create an account and access the system.

Core Domain Objects:
- User
- Credentials
- Account

Attributes & Rules:
- The registration form must validate mandatory fields (name, email, password).
- Password must meet security criteria (minimum length, complexity).
- Email must be unique and properly formatted.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Successful Registration
Given the registration form is displayed
When the user enters valid data and submits the form
Then the system should create a new user account
And send a confirmation email to the user

Scenario: Registration with an existing email
Given the registration form is displayed
When the user enters an email that is already registered
Then the system should prevent registration
And display an error message about the duplicate email

Scenario: Registration with invalid data
Given the registration form is displayed
When the user enters invalid data (e.g., weak password, incorrect email format)
Then the system should display appropriate error messages

Test Cases:

Feature: User Registration

Scenario: Successful Registration
Given the registration form is displayed
When the user enters valid data
Then the system should create a new account and send a confirmation email

Scenario: Registration with an existing email
Given the registration form is displayed
When the user enters an email that is already registered
Then the system should display a duplicate email error message

Scenario: Registration with invalid data
Given the registration form is displayed
When the user enters invalid data
Then the system should display appropriate error messages

Priority: High - New users need to register to access the platform

user_stories.epic_title: Implement user authentication and authorization features.
user_stories.title: Develop user login capability
user_stories.description:
As a registered user, I want to log in to the platform, so that I can access my account and its features.

Core Domain Objects:
- Session
- Token
- User

Attributes & Rules:
- Authenticated sessions must have a validity period.
- Password must be hashed and not stored in plain text.
- Invalid login attempts must be limited to prevent breaches (account lockout).

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Successful Login
Given the login form is displayed
When the user enters valid credentials
Then the system should authenticate the user
And start a session with a valid token

Scenario: Login with invalid credentials
Given the login form is displayed
When the user enters invalid credentials
Then the system should display an error message
And prevent access

Scenario: Account Lockout
Given multiple failed login attempts
When the user attempts to log in again
Then the system should lock the account
And display a lockout message

Test Cases:

Feature: User Login

Scenario: Successful Login
Given the login form is displayed
When the user enters valid credentials
Then the system should authenticate the user and start a session

Scenario: Login with invalid credentials
Given the login form is displayed
When the user enters invalid credentials
Then the system should display an error message

Scenario: Account Lockout
Given multiple failed login attempts
When the user attempts to log in again
Then the system should lock the account and display a lockout message

Priority: High - Registered users need to log in to access their accounts and use the platform

user_stories.epic_title: Implement user authentication and authorization features.
user_stories.title: Develop user logout capability
user_stories.description:
As an authenticated user, I want to log out from the platform, so that I can securely end my session.

Core Domain Objects:
- Session
- Token

Attributes & Rules:
- The session should be invalidated upon logout.
- The token must be removed from the server.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Successful Logout
Given the user is logged in
When the user clicks the logout button
Then the system should terminate the session
And redirect the user to the login page

Scenario: Session Invalidated on Logout
Given the user is logged in
When the user logs out
Then the session token must be invalidated
And no further actions should be allowed using the token

Test Cases:

Feature: User Logout

Scenario: Successful Logout
Given the user is logged in
When the user clicks the logout button
Then the system should terminate the session and redirect to the login page

Scenario: Session Invalidated on Logout
Given the user is logged in
When the user logs out
Then the session token must be invalidated

Priority: Medium - Logging out ensures user security and session management

user_stories.epic_title: Implement user authentication and authorization features.
user_stories.title: Implement role-based access control
user_stories.description:
As an admin, I want to manage user roles, so that I can control access to certain features based on the user's role.

Core Domain Objects:
- Role
- Permission
- User

Attributes & Rules:
- Roles must be predefined (admin, user, guest).
- Each role must have a set of permissions that allow or restrict access to features.
- Only admin should be allowed to assign or change roles.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Assign Role to User
Given a user account exists
When the admin assigns a role to the user
Then the user should have permissions associated with the role

Scenario: Access Control Based on Role
Given the user has a specific role
When the user tries to access a restricted feature
Then the system should allow or deny access based on permissions

Scenario: Change User Role
Given the user has a default role
When the admin changes the user's role
Then the user should get the new role's permissions

Test Cases:

Feature: Role-Based Access Control

Scenario: Assign Role to User
Given a user account exists
When the admin assigns a role to the user
Then the user should have permissions associated with the role

Scenario: Access Control Based on Role
Given the user has a specific role
When the user tries to access a restricted feature
Then the system should allow or deny access based on permissions

Scenario: Change User Role
Given the user has a default role
When the admin changes the user's role
Then the user should get the new role's permissions

Priority: High - Role-based access control is critical for managing access and security within the platform

user_stories.title: Create User Table in PostgreSQL
user_stories.description:
As a data engineer, I want to create a user table in PostgreSQL, so that we can store user information efficiently.

- User

Attributes & Rules:
- User ID must be unique
- User email must be unique
- Password should be encrypted

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Successful User Table Creation
Given a PostgreSQL instance
When I create the user table with the specified columns
Then the table should be created successfully
And all constraints should be enforced

Scenario: Duplicate User ID
Given an existing user with a specific User ID
When I try to insert another user with the same User ID
Then the insertion should fail

Scenario: Non-unique Email
Given an existing user with a specific email
When I try to insert another user with the same email
Then the insertion should fail

Then the table should be created successfully
And all constraints should be enforced

Scenario: Duplicate User ID

Then the insertion should fail

Scenario: Non-unique Email
Given an existing user with a specific email
When I try to insert another user with the same email
Then the insertion should fail

Priority: High - Ensures data integrity and unique user identification

- Links

- Accessible navigation
- Support for multiple devices

Then I should see the navigation bar at the top
And it should contain links to main sections

Scenario: Responsive navigation bar

Scenario: Navigation links accessibility
Given I am a user with accessibility needs
When I use a screen reader

user_stories.epic_title: Implement the product catalog feature.
user_stories.title: Display Product Details
user_stories.description:
As a shopper, I want to view product details, so that I can make an informed purchase decision.

Core Domain Objects:
- Product
- Product Details
- Shopper

Attributes & Rules:
- Products must have a name.
- Products must have a price.
- Products must have a description.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: View product details
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects a product
Then the product details page should be displayed
And the product name, price, and description should be visible

Scenario: No product details available
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects a product with no details
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Product details are not available"

Scenario: Product details data fetch fails
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When there is a failure in fetching product details from the database
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Unable to retrieve product details"

Test Cases:

Feature: Display Product Details

Scenario: View product details
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects a product
Then the product details page should be displayed
And the product name, price, and description should be visible

Scenario: No product details available
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects a product with no details
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Product details are not available"

Scenario: Product details data fetch fails
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When there is a failure in fetching product details from the database
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Unable to retrieve product details"

Priority: High - Providing accurate product details is critical for making purchase decisions.

user_stories.epic_title: Implement the product catalog feature.
user_stories.title: Filter Products by Category
user_stories.description:
As a shopper, I want to filter products by category, so that I can easily find the products I am interested in.

Core Domain Objects:
- Product
- Category
- Filter
- Shopper

Attributes & Rules:
- Filter options must be populated from the product categories.
- Selected filter must update the product list to show only products in that category.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Filter by category
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects a category filter
Then the product list should update to show only products in the selected category

Scenario: No products in selected category
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects an empty category filter
Then an informational message should be displayed stating "No products found in this category"

Scenario: Filter data fetch fails
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When there is a failure in fetching filter data from the database
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Unable to retrieve filter options"

Test Cases:

Feature: Filter Products by Category

Scenario: Filter by category
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects a category filter
Then the product list should update to show only products in the selected category

Scenario: No products in selected category
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects an empty category filter
Then an informational message should be displayed stating "No products found in this category"

Scenario: Filter data fetch fails
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When there is a failure in fetching filter data from the database
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Unable to retrieve filter options"

Priority: Medium - Allowing shoppers to filter by category enhances the shopping experience and helps in finding products quickly.

user_stories.epic_title: Implement the product catalog feature.
user_stories.title: Sort Products by Price
user_stories.description:
As a shopper, I want to sort products by price, so that I can find products within my budget range.

Core Domain Objects:
- Product
- Price
- Sort Option
- Shopper

Attributes & Rules:
- Sort options should include ascending and descending by price.
- Selected sort option must reorder the product list accordingly.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Sort products by price ascending
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects the sort by price ascending option
Then the product list should be sorted from lowest to highest price

Scenario: Sort products by price descending
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects the sort by price descending option
Then the product list should be sorted from highest to lowest price

Scenario: Sort data fetch fails
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When there is a failure in fetching sorting data from the database
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Unable to retrieve sorting options"

Test Cases:

Feature: Sort Products by Price

Scenario: Sort products by price ascending
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects the sort by price ascending option
Then the product list should be sorted from lowest to highest price

Scenario: Sort products by price descending
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When the shopper selects the sort by price descending option
Then the product list should be sorted from highest to lowest price

Scenario: Sort data fetch fails
Given the shopper is on the product catalog page
When there is a failure in fetching sorting data from the database
Then an error message should be displayed stating "Unable to retrieve sorting options"

Priority: Low - Sorting products by price is useful but not essential compared to other product catalog features.

user_stories.epic_title: Develop the shopping cart functionality.
user_stories.title: Add products to the shopping cart
user_stories.description:
As a shopper, I want to add products to the shopping cart, so that I can buy multiple items.

Core Domain Objects:
- Product
- Shopping Cart
- User

Attributes & Rules:
- Product must be available in inventory.
- Shopping cart must be associated with the current user.
- Cart can have multiple products.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Add available product to the cart
Given a product is available in inventory
When I add the product to the shopping cart
Then the product should be added to my shopping cart
And I should see the updated cart content

Scenario: Add unavailable product to the cart
Given a product is not available in inventory
When I attempt to add the product to the shopping cart
Then I should be notified that the product is unavailable

Scenario: Add multiple items to the cart
Given multiple products are available in inventory
When I add different products to the shopping cart
Then all selected products should be added to my shopping cart
And I should see the updated cart content

Test Cases:

Feature: Add products to the shopping cart

Scenario: Add available product to the cart
Given a product is available in inventory
When I add the product to the shopping cart
Then the product should be added to my shopping cart
And I should see the updated cart content

Scenario: Add unavailable product to the cart
Given a product is not available in inventory
When I attempt to add the product to the shopping cart
Then I should be notified that the product is unavailable

Scenario: Add multiple items to the cart
Given multiple products are available in inventory
When I add different products to the shopping cart
Then all selected products should be added to my shopping cart
And I should see the updated cart content

Priority: High - Critical for functionality to support product purchasing

user_stories.epic_title: Develop the shopping cart functionality.
user_stories.title: Update product quantities in the shopping cart
user_stories.description:
As a shopper, I want to update product quantities in the shopping cart, so that I can change my purchase amounts.

Core Domain Objects:
- Product
- Shopping Cart
- User

Attributes & Rules:
- Product quantities must not exceed available inventory.
- Shopping cart must reflect the updated quantities.
- Zero quantity should remove the product from the cart.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Update product quantity in the cart
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I change the product quantity
Then the updated quantity should be reflected in my cart
And the total price should be updated accordingly

Scenario: Increase product quantity beyond available stock
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I attempt to increase the quantity beyond available stock
Then I should be notified that the requested quantity is not available

Scenario: Set product quantity to zero
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I change the product quantity to zero
Then the product should be removed from my shopping cart

Test Cases:

Feature: Update product quantities in the shopping cart

Scenario: Update product quantity in the cart
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I change the product quantity
Then the updated quantity should be reflected in my cart
And the total price should be updated accordingly

Scenario: Increase product quantity beyond available stock
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I attempt to increase the quantity beyond available stock
Then I should be notified that the requested quantity is not available

Scenario: Set product quantity to zero
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I change the product quantity to zero
Then the product should be removed from my shopping cart

Priority: High - Essential for users to manage their purchase quantities

user_stories.epic_title: Develop the shopping cart functionality.
user_stories.title: Remove products from the shopping cart
user_stories.description:
As a shopper, I want to remove products from the shopping cart, so that I can adjust my selection before purchase.

Core Domain Objects:
- Product
- Shopping Cart
- User

Attributes & Rules:
- Users must be able to remove any product from the cart.
- Shopping cart should update to reflect the removed product.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Remove a product from the cart
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I choose to remove the product from the cart
Then the product should be removed from my shopping cart
And the total price should be updated accordingly

Scenario: Remove a product that is not in the cart
Given a product is not in my shopping cart
When I attempt to remove the product from the cart
Then I should be notified that the product is not in the cart

Scenario: Remove multiple products from the cart
Given multiple products are in my shopping cart
When I choose to remove several products from the cart
Then the selected products should be removed from my shopping cart
And the total price should be updated accordingly

Test Cases:

Feature: Remove products from the shopping cart

Scenario: Remove a product from the cart
Given a product is in my shopping cart
When I choose to remove the product from the cart
Then the product should be removed from my shopping cart
And the total price should be updated accordingly

Scenario: Remove a product that is not in the cart
Given a product is not in my shopping cart
When I attempt to remove the product from the cart
Then I should be notified that the product is not in the cart

Scenario: Remove multiple products from the cart
Given multiple products are in my shopping cart
When I choose to remove several products from the cart
Then the selected products should be removed from my shopping cart
And the total price should be updated accordingly

Priority: Medium - Important for flexibility in managing cart content

user_stories.epic_title: Develop the shopping cart functionality.
user_stories.title: Persist shopping cart state in PostgreSQL
user_stories.description:
As a backend system, I want to store the shopping cart state in PostgreSQL, so that the cart persists across sessions.

Core Domain Objects:
- Shopping Cart
- Product
- User
- PostgreSQL Database

Attributes & Rules:
- Shopping cart state must be saved to the database.
- Cart must be retrievable by user ID.
- Ensure data consistency and integrity.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Save shopping cart to database
Given a shopping cart with products
When the user adds/updates/removes products
Then the cart state should be saved to the PostgreSQL database
And the updated state should be consistent with user actions

Scenario: Retrieve shopping cart from database
Given a user logs back in
When the user accesses their shopping cart
Then the cart state should be retrieved from the PostgreSQL database
And should reflect the last saved state

Scenario: Handle database errors
Given a database connection issue occurs
When attempting to save the cart state
Then the system should handle the error gracefully
And notify the user of the issue

Test Cases:

Feature: Persist shopping cart state in PostgreSQL

Scenario: Save shopping cart to database
Given a shopping cart with products
When the user adds/updates/removes products
Then the cart state should be saved to the PostgreSQL database
And the updated state should be consistent with user actions

Scenario: Retrieve shopping cart from database
Given a user logs back in
When the user accesses their shopping cart
Then the cart state should be retrieved from the PostgreSQL database
And should reflect the last saved state

Scenario: Handle database errors
Given a database connection issue occurs
When attempting to save the cart state
Then the system should handle the error gracefully
And notify the user of the issue

Priority: High - Critical for providing a seamless user experience

Given a customer is on the checkout page
When they enter invalid payment details
And submit the payment
Then the payment should fail
And the customer should be notified of the failure

- Order
- PostgreSQL Database

Attributes & Rules:
- Orders must be stored with a unique order ID.
- Order details should include items, prices, customer information, and transaction ID.
- Data storage should ensure ACID properties for reliability.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Store order in database
Given a successful transaction
When the order is confirmed
Then order details should be persisted in PostgreSQL with a unique order ID
And should include items, prices, customer information, and transaction ID

Scenario: Ensure data integrity
Given concurrent transactions
When multiple orders are placed simultaneously
Then each order should be stored correctly with no data loss or inconsistency

user_stories.epic_title: Implement order management features for users and administrators.

user_stories.description:
As a user, I want to view my order history, so that I can keep track of my purchases.

- Order
- User

Attributes & Rules:
- Orders should be displayed in chronological order.
- Each order should show details such as order ID, items, total amount, and status.
- Users should be able to view order history only for their own account.

Acceptance Criteria:

Given a user is logged in
When the user navigates to the order history page
Then the user should see a list of their past orders in chronological order
And each order should show the order ID, items, total amount, and status

Scenario: User has no order history
Given a user is logged in
And the user has no past orders
When the user navigates to the order history page
Then the user should see a message indicating that they have no orders

user_stories.epic_title: Implement order management features for users and administrators.
user_stories.title: Manage and Update Order Statuses
user_stories.description:
As an administrator, I want to manage and update order statuses, so that I can keep customers informed about their order progress.

Core Domain Objects:
- Order
- Administrator

Attributes & Rules:
- Administrators should be able to update order statuses to 'Processing', 'Shipped', 'Delivered', or 'Cancelled'.
- Status updates should be logged with a timestamp.
- Only administrators should have the permission to update order statuses.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Administrator updates order status
Given an administrator is logged in
And has permission to manage orders
When the administrator updates the status of an order
Then the status should be changed to the selected status
And the update should be logged with a timestamp

Scenario: Order status updated by non-administrator
Given a user is logged in
And the user is not an administrator
When the user attempts to update an order status
Then the user should receive an error message indicating lack of permissions

Test Cases:

Given a user is logged in
And the user is not an administrator
When the user attempts to update an order status
Then the user should receive an error message indicating lack of permissions

Priority: High - Keeping order statuses updated is essential for customer satisfaction and internal tracking.

user_stories.epic_title: Implement order management features for users and administrators.
user_stories.title: Store Order Data in PostgreSQL
user_stories.description:
As a system administrator, I want all order data to be stored in PostgreSQL, so that we can ensure data integrity and reliability.

Core Domain Objects:
- Order
- Database

Attributes & Rules:
- The PostgreSQL database should be the single source of truth for all order data.
- Order data should include order ID, user ID, item details, total amount, status, and timestamps.
- Data integrity constraints must be enforced at the database level.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Order creation logs data in PostgreSQL
Given an order is placed by a user
When the order is created in the system
Then the order details should be stored in PostgreSQL
And data integrity constraints should be validated

Scenario: Update order logs data in PostgreSQL
Given an order exists in the system
When the order details are updated
Then the changes should be reflected in PostgreSQL
And the update should be recorded with a timestamp

user_stories.epic_title: Implement features for user profile and account management.

Attributes & Rules:

When I update my personal information in my profile
Then the information is saved successfully
And it is reflected in the database

Scenario: Failure when updating personal information with invalid data
Given I have provided invalid personal information
When I try to save the updated personal information
Then I receive an error message
And the information is not saved

Scenario: Ensure data security during update
Given I am updating my personal information
When the data is transmitted to the server
Then the data is encrypted
And it is stored securely

- Old password must be validated before setting a new one.

And the new password is securely stored

When I attempt to change the password
Then I receive an error message indicating complexity requirements
And my password is not changed

Scenario: Failure when existing password is incorrect
Given I provide an incorrect existing password
When I attempt to change the password
Then I receive an error message indicating incorrect password
And my password is not changed

user_stories.epic_title: Implement features for user profile and account management.
user_stories.title: Ensure Secure Storage and Retrieval
user_stories.description:
As a developer, I want to ensure that user information is securely stored and retrieved from PostgreSQL, so that user data remains safe from unauthorized access.

Core Domain Objects:
- User Profile
- Account
- PostgreSQL Database

Attributes & Rules:
- Data must be encrypted at rest and in transit.
- Access to data must be restricted based on user roles.
- Regular audits must be performed to ensure compliance with security protocols.

Acceptance Criteria:

Scenario: Data encryption at rest
Given data is saved to the PostgreSQL database
When data is written to the database
Then it must be encrypted
And not accessible in plain text

Scenario: Data encryption in transit
Given data is being transmitted to/from the server
When data travels over the network
Then it must be encrypted
And protected from interception

Scenario: Role-based data access
Given a user with appropriate permissions
When they access user data
Then they can access only authorized information
And all access must be logged

Given the user is authenticated
When the user submits a review missing some required fields
Then an error message is displayed indicating the incomplete fields

Scenario: User submits a review with an invalid rating
Given the user is authenticated
When the user submits a review with a rating outside the range of 1 to 5
Then an error message is displayed indicating the invalid rating

Given a product has no reviews
When the user visits the product detail page
Then a message is displayed indicating no reviews are available

Scenario: Review moderation is applied
Given a review is submitted
When the review is moderated and approved
Then the review is displayed on the product detail page

architecture_generation.description: This architecture diagram outlines the Azure-based services and resources for building a secure and user-friendly self-service banking portal with features such as authentication, notifications, real-time updates, and CI/CD pipelines.

architecture_validation.updatedDescription: The architecture diagram has been enhanced to address security and reliability gaps by introducing Azure Firewall, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF), and Azure SQL Database Geo-Replication. Placeholder nodes were added for missing components, and all nodes and edges have been validated for consistency and completeness. The architecture now aligns better with the Azure Well-Architected Framework, achieving a higher quality rating.
